abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and Occupational Safety and Health Administration issue new set of guidelines to protect workers from occupational exposure to Zika virus; guidelines include letting pregnant women and those planning to become pregnant, as well as their male partners, to work indoors and delay work-related travel to areas where virus is circulating.
lead_paragraph: A set of guidelines from two federal agencies has blunt instructions to curb mosquitoes and more cautious advice about where some employees should work.

headline.main: Employers Urged to Prevent Zika Infections at Work
headline.print_headline: Employers Urged to Prevent Zika Infections at Work

snippet: A set of guidelines from two federal agencies has blunt instructions to curb mosquitoes and more cautious advice about where some employees should work.

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
